intro: Melampyrum alpestre, commonly known as the alpine touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, reddish or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are opposite and sessile, with a distinctive shape that aids in identification. Melampyrum alpestre is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
